'Vietnamese' () is the national, official language of Vietnam. It is the native
language of Vietnamese people (Kinh), and of about three million Vietnamese
residing elsewhere. It also is spoken as a first or second language by many
ethnic minorities of Vietnam.

It is part of the Austroasiatic language family of which it has, by far, the
most speakers (several times that of the other Austroasiatic languages
combined). Vietnamese vocabulary has borrowings from Chinese, and it formerly
used a modified set of Chinese characters called chá»¯ nÃ´m given vernacular
pronunciation. As a byproduct of French colonial rule, Vietnamese was influenced
by the French language; the Vietnamese alphabet (quá»c ngá»¯) in use today is a
Latin alphabet with additional diacritics for tones, and certain letters.
